headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JUNE 15, 1935.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 17. -- The April decline in American exports, including re-exports, was caused by a decrease in buying of all "grand divisions" except northern North America and South America, the Commerce Department's monthly analysis said today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 17. -- The April decline in American exports, including re-exports, was caused by a decrease in buying of all "grand divisions" except northern North America and South America, the Commerce Department's monthly analysis said today.

headline.main: APRIL EXPORTS ROSE TO SOUTH AMERICA; Africa Also Took More Goods in Comparison With Same Month Last Year.

docs.snippet: WHEN Peter Christ tried to tell a sports editor on a tabloid newspaper one day last week how he had murdered his wife while their small son looked on and then ambushed her lover, the editor said: "It's a very warm day and I'm very busy." So Peter...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN Peter Christ tried to tell a sports editor on a tabloid newspaper one day last week how he had murdered his wife while their small son looked on and then ambushed her lover, the editor said: "It's a very warm day and I'm very busy." So Peter Christ pulled out a blackjack and pistol and started over again. That time he was listened to.
docs.abstract: Dombrowski, Katharina von; Land of Women

headline.main: ROTARY CONVENTION ENDS.; E.R. Johnson of Roanoke Elected President in Mexican Session.

docs.snippet: Export organizations last week launched a drive to break up what they term is an international confidence game through which Germany is victimizing Latin-American nations to the tune of millions in sterling and dollar exchange.
docs.lead_paragraph: Export organizations last week launched a drive to break up what they term is an international confidence game through which Germany is victimizing Latin-American nations to the tune of millions in sterling and dollar exchange.
docs.abstract: Export groups hold Latin Amer countries are being duped into financing German foreign trade by agreements to accept registered German marks in payment for products sold to Germany

headline.main: HOLD LATIN AMERICA DUPED BY GERMAN; Exporters Seek Check on Deals Involving Registered Marks in 'Confidence Game.'

docs.snippet: Business in the foreign exchange market last week showed little of the nervousness and wide fluctuations of earlier weeks. More settled political and financial conditions in Europe, particularly in France where the Chamber of Deputies is in recess,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Business in the foreign exchange market last week showed little of the nervousness and wide fluctuations of earlier weeks. More settled political and financial conditions in Europe, particularly in France where the Chamber of Deputies is in recess, aided in the evenness of the market.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JUNE 22, 1935.
